metadata.title: CVE-2018-19486 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Git before 2.19.2 on Linux and UNIX executes commands from the currentworking directory (as if '.' were at the end of $PATH) in certain casesinvolving the run_command() API and run-command.c, because there was adangerous change from execvp to execv during 2017.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19486` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-all - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-cvs - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-run - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-el - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-email - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-gui - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-man - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-mediawiki - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
git-svn - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitk - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
gitweb - 1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.17.1-1ubuntu0.4').
